articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Graphic shows visual representation of coronavirus
articles.description: A video graphic has been published showing a representation of the coronavirus that is sweeping the planet.
articles.content:
A video graphic has been published showing a representation of the coronavirus that is sweeping the planet.
So far the virus has infected more than 180,000 people and killed more than 7,100 worldwide, according to a Reuters tally.
The graphic was produced b… [+859 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Aviation battles coronavirus cash crunch
articles.description: Boeing and other U.S. aviation companies are seeking billions of dollars in aid as they battle to survive a plunge in demand caused by the coronavirus pandemic, while Airbus is pausing production at two sites to bolster health and safety measures.
articles.content:
Boeing and other U.S. aviation companies are seeking billions of dollars in aid as they battle to survive a plunge in demand caused by the coronavirus pandemic, while Airbus is pausing production at two sites to bolster health and safety measures.

articles.author: RTÉ Sport
articles.title: Juventus' Blaise Matuidi tests positive for coronavirus
articles.description: Juventus and France midfielder Blaise Matuidi has tested positive for coronavirus.
articles.content:
Juventus and France midfielder Blaise Matuidi has tested positive for the coronavirus.
A statement on the club's website read: "Blaise Matuidi has undergone medical tests that have revealed his positivity to the Coronavirus-COVID-19.
"The player, as of Wedn… [+518 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ Sport
articles.title: Halep donates funds to aid in fight against coronavirus
articles.description: Wimbledon champion and world number two Simona Halep said she was donating money to pay for medical equipment in Romania as the country deals with the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.content:
Wimbledon champion and world number two Simona Halep said she was donating money to pay for medical equipment in Romania as the country deals with the coronavirus pandemic.
